title: 114_hr5292
content: The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows for the hiring of air traffic controllers. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows preferential consideration for qualified individuals with 52 consecutive weeks of air traffic control experience for air traffic controller positions. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows preferential consideration for qualified individuals with 52 consecutive weeks of air traffic control experience for air traffic controller positions. The Administrator shall consider additional applicants for the position of air traffic controller by referring an approximately equal number of employees for appointment among 2 applicant pools. Pool one consists of applicants who work in a traffic control facility, a civilian or military air traffic control facility of the Department of Defense, or a tower operating under contract with the Federal Aviation Administration under section 47124. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows preferential consideration for qualified individuals with air traffic controller training from an institution participating in the Collegiate Training Initiative program. Applicants must have received a recommendation or endorsement certifying their qualifications. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" provides preferential consideration for qualified individuals with air traffic controller training from specific institutions. Eligibility criteria include veterans with aviation experience or preference eligible veterans. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" provides preferential consideration for qualified individuals with air traffic controller training from specific institutions, including veterans with aviation experience or preference eligible veterans. Pool two of applicants consists of all United States citizens applying under a vacancy announcement. The Administration is prohibited from using biographical assessments when hiring under certain circumstances. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows disqualified applicants from a specific vacancy announcement to reapply under revised hiring practices, with a waiver of age restrictions for air traffic controller positions. The "Air Traffic Controller Hiring Improvement Act of 2016" allows reapplication for disqualified individuals meeting age requirements for air traffic controller positions. The maximum age for original appointment is set at 35 years.
